issue.title: Do a review and plan improvements to our Flowershow/PortalJS app template
issue.body:
PortalJS / Flowershow is now quite heavily used by us and others. It would be good to do a review of the template to see how we can improve or clean-up in various areas.

NB: Flowershow template is normally the base for PortalJS templates so that is the focus.

## Acceptance

- [x] Reviewed main areas of e.g. flowershow template https://github.com/datopian/flowershow
- [x] Identified any areas for improvement et

## Tasks

- [x] Do a first pass and flag the main areas to look at @olayway ⏲️2h

## Ola's notes

Potential areas for improvement:

- fix search feature finally... **🔥 not sure what's the issue so hard to estimate, but my guesstimate is 2h**
- `content/config.js` file - review customisation options and field names, include all available options in the file for the user (even if with default values or commented out), make sure all the fields are well documented **⬆️ ~ 2h**
- eject `Layout` component **🔥 ~ 2h**
	- currently imported from `@portaljs/core` but more often than not it is subject to customisations 
	- only specific UI/logic parts it encapsulates should be componentised and imported in the ejected Layout that lives in the template - this way users (and we) could easily remove/add/swap only specific parts of it - atm if we only want to update e.g. the Navbar, we can't, we have to recreate (or copy) the whole Layout 
- upgrade to App Router, e.g. for: **⬆️ ~ 1/2-1 day**
	- build-in SEO support
	- easy fetching any layout related frontmatter fields by the Layout itself (no need to pass from page -> to custom app -> to Layout)
	- ...
- add back eslint and prettier as dev deps for tech savy users convenience and for ourselves **⬇️ ~ 0.5h**
- we still don't have template versioning/releases set up properly at Flowershow template **🔥 ~ 1/2 day**
	- it would make our lives easier to compare apps built with the template and the original template itself, and thus quickly asses if we need/want to upgrade, just by looking at the CHANGELOG
	- the same goes for all Flowershow users...

Specific parts of code that could be improved:
https://github.com/datopian/flowershow/pull/582/files

comment.body:
We have a list of improvements and a PR. Only suggestion for @olayway is to perhaps classify by value and cost e.g. 

> this is a must-have and takes probably ~1d etc.

Once that is done can you close as FIXED.

issue.title: Fixing regex to not remove dashes "-" from markdown links
issue.body:
Fixes this broken test: https://github.com/datopian/flowershow/pull/576

## Changes

- Changed the regex to permit dashes

CC: @anuveyatsu @olayway @demenech

comment.body: Although a very important fix, this is neither a major nor even minor change 😉 It's a backward-compatible patch.

repo.name: portaljs
repo.description: 🌀 Rapidly build rich data portals using a modern frontend framework

repo.name: portaljs
repo.description: 🌀 Rapidly build rich data portals using a modern frontend framework

comment.body: This test is not needed I think. Aliases are not extracted with regex. Anything between the alias divider and the closing brackets is recognized as a wikilink alias and tokenized as such. Take a look at this file for ref: https://github.com/datopian/portaljs/blob/main/packages/remark-wiki-link/src/lib/syntax.ts

comment.body: I don't think we need a separate test for each of these cases. I'd merge them into one with some crazy wiki link having accented letters, spaces, dashes and a bunch of other signs.

issue.title: Do a review and plan improvements to our Flowershow/PortalJS app template
issue.body:
PortalJS / Flowershow is now quite heavily used by us and others. It would be good to do a review of the template to see how we can improve or clean-up in various areas.

NB: Flowershow template is normally the base for PortalJS templates so that is the focus.

## Acceptance

- [ ] Reviewed main areas of e.g. flowershow template https://github.com/datopian/flowershow
- [ ] Identified any areas for improvement et

## Tasks

- [x] Do a first pass and flag the main areas to look at @olayway ⏲️2h

## Ola's notes

Potential areas for improvement:

- fix search feature finally...
- `content/config.js` file - review customisation options and field names, include all available options in the file for the user (even if with default values or commented out)
- eject `Layout` component
	- currently imported from `@portaljs/core` but more often than not it is subject to customisations
	- only specific UI/logic parts it encapsulates should be componentised and imported in the ejected Layout that lives in the template - this way users (and we) could easily remove/add/swap only specific parts of it - atm if we only want to update e.g. the Navbar, we can't, we have to recreate (or copy) the whole Layout 
- upgrade to App Router, e.g. for:
	- build-in SEO support
	- easy fetching any layout related frontmatter fields by the Layout itself (no need to pass from page -> to custom app -> to Layout)
	- ...
- add back eslint and prettier as dev deps for tech savy users convenience and for ourselves
- we still don't have template versioning/releases set up properly at Flowershow template
	- it would make our lives easier to compare apps built with the template and the original template itself, and thus quickly asses if we need/want to upgrade, just by looking at the CHANGELOG
	- the same goes for all Flowershow users...

Specific parts of code that could be improved:
https://github.com/datopian/flowershow/pull/582/files

comment.body: Great, can you update acceptabce and suggest specific next steps if any with estimate

issue.title: Surfacing examples in the docs
issue.body:
Hey there! I was looking for some examples and clicked on https://portaljs.org/ `Examples` menu tab. That link is [fowarding users to GitHub](https://github.com/datopian/portaljs/tree/main/examples) with a bunch of awesome examples. 

As an user, it would be great to have a few URLs I can click and see the final result. E.g having a link to the [deployed `fivethirtyeight` website](https://github.com/datopian/portaljs/tree/main/examples/fivethirtyeight).

issue.title: Help wanted testing new tutorial (April 2023)
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/datopian/portaljs/discussions/820

When I ran the npm run dev command, it took 5 to 10 minutes, and I encountered these errors (npm ERR! code ENOENT
npm ERR! syscall open
npm ERR! path C:\Users\user\Desktop\New folder\package.json
npm ERR! errno -4058
npm ERR! enoent Could not read package.json: Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'C:\Users\user\Desktop\New folder\package.json'
npm ERR! enoent This is related to npm not being able to find a file.
npm ERR! enoent). Dark mode is enabled by default. Overall, the user experience was intuitive and easy to follow.

issue.title: Help wanted testing new tutorial (April 2023)
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/datopian/portaljs/discussions/820

When I ran the npm run dev command, it took 5 to 10 minutes, and I encountered these errors (npm ERR! code ENOENT
npm ERR! syscall open
npm ERR! path C:\Users\user\Desktop\New folder\package.json
npm ERR! errno -4058
npm ERR! enoent Could not read package.json: Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'C:\Users\user\Desktop\New folder\package.json'
npm ERR! enoent This is related to npm not being able to find a file.
npm ERR! enoent). Dark mode is enabled by default. Overall, the user experience was intuitive and easy to follow.

comment.body: Yep, I noticed but I didn't change it because I thought that was a proposal range, and in the HTML was that same thought (to change something planned before). Thank you for all the clarification and help. I'll fix it.

issue.title: How we built the new OpenSpending.org with PortalJS (dev oriented)
issue.body:
Dev oriented overview/tutorial of how we build new OpenSpending.org with PortalJS - follow up and complement to #882 

## Acceptance

- [x] Mention background blog post - ie https://www.datopian.com/blog/the-open-spending-revamp
- [ ] Link to github repo
- [ ] Explain key items e.g.
  - [ ] Where we stored data
  - [ ] It's format
  - [ ] How we pulled that into the frontend
  - [ ] Repeat: where you can find the code, get help etc
- [ ] Some nice screenshots including of code

## Tasks

- [x] Bullet point outline
- [x] Tidy
- [x] Post **2023-10-16 :heavy_check_mark: FIXED. See https://www.datopian.com/blog/the-open-spending-revamp-behind-the-scenes and https://portaljs.org/blog/the-open-spending-revamp-behind-the-scenes.**
- [ ] Promote

comment.body: @demenech can you update acceptance with links 😄
